directions:
Place the tomatoes in a small baking pan and drizzle with 1
    tablesppon of the olive oil and a pinch of salt. Roast for 45
    minutes, stirring occasionally, until they're split and blistered
    and super sweet

Place the chicken breasts between two pieces of baking
    parchment paper. Using a mallet, pound the chicken breasts until
    they're very, very thin - you should almost be able to see through
    them -- about 1/6-inch thick.

Put the milk in a shallow bowl and the bread crumbs on a
    large plate. Dip each piece of chicken in to the milk and then
    dregde it in the bread crumbs, tapping off the excess. You should
    have a thin, even coating.

Heat 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large nonstick skilet big
    enough to hold 2 pieces of the chicken in a single layer. Cook for
    about 4 minutes on the fside, or until evenly browned and crisp.

Flip and cook for an additional 2 or 3 minutes, or until the
    other side is browned and crisp and the chicken is firm to the
    touch.

Wipe out the skillet and repeat with the remaining 1/4 cup of
    olive oil and the remaining 2 pieces of chicken

Toss the arugula with the remaining tablesoon of olive oil,
    the vinegar and a pinch of salt. Fold the tomatoes into the
    arugula.
Top the chicken with the tomato and arugula
ingredients: 2 cups plain bread crumbs (panko is preferred)
1/2 cup plus 2 tablesppons extra virgin olive oil, divided
source: Gwyneth Paltrow, from My Father's Daughter pg. 146
title: Slow Roasted Cherry Tomatoes and Arugula Chicken Milanese
